Title: Loan Compliance Specialist Primary Validator
Job Description:
About the Role:
Summary
This position is responsible for performing the primary review on all reportable loans related to the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA), and the Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) as well as the review and monitoring of Flood Insurance to ensure the bank is compliant with regulations and internal policy and procedures.

The compensation range for this position is $35.00-$43.00 hourly and will vary depending on what city the applicant works in. All compensation offers are analyzed individually and take into consideration multiple factors including but not limited to geographic location, years of experience, and educational background .

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Performs lending compliance monitoring procedures in accordance with the Bank’s compliance monitoring programs for Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA); Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) and the Flood Disaster Protection Program (Flood).
Analyze and interpret loan applications and related documentation gathered during the loan underwriting and processing stages to appropriately code for HMDA and CRA reporting purposes.
Coordinate and collaborate with various departments within the Bank to resolve any inconsistencies in loan data and recommend changes warranted that will ensure the efficiency and accuracy of reporting HMDA, CRA and Flood data.
Maintain a good working knowledge of consumer and commercial loan documentation and the various rules, regulations and practices governing the execution and perfection of documentation.
Maintain a good working knowledge of the requirements of HMDA to perform primary validation to ensure all data points are valid and supported with required source documentation.
Maintain a good working knowledge of CRA related to small farm/small business reporting requirements to perform primary validation to ensure all data points are valid and supported with required source documentation.
Maintain a good working knowledge of Flood requirements to perform primary review to ensure adequate coverage for applicable loans.
Perform monthly and semi-annual flood reviews and report any findings to Manager.
Maintain a good working knowledge of section 1071 of the Dodd-Frank Act (when implemented by the CFPB).
Assist in training and providing direction on compliance related laws and regulations as well as provide technical lending compliance support to loan staff.
Interact regularly with loan staff, management and compliance officer on special situations and corrective action needed regarding loan compliance related to Consumer and Commercial loans.
Prepares various reports pertaining to HMDA, CRA and Flood monitoring per regulatory guidelines and internal procedures.
Assist in the facilitation and participation in division Management Compliance Committee meetings to provide information on error ratios and trends related to HMDA, CRA and Flood.
Maintain tickler tracking for flood notifications and send required notification letters to customers as required.
Prepare reports detailing error, resolution, and trends for HMDA, CRA and Flood data to Management and division’s Compliance Committee.
Assist with the development, implementation, and maintenance of compliance procedures to help staff adhere to applicable laws and regulations, make recommendations to Manager when appropriate.
Perform secondary validation and follow procedures for monitoring and reporting related to HMDA and CRA in a back-up capacity as outlined in the job description for Loan Compliance Specialist Secondary Validator.
Validate 10% of loans booked monthly for compliance to policies, procedures and related regulation and report finding to Manager

Other Job Functions:
Participate in ongoing training courses to keep current with policies, procedures and banking regulations, to include completing BVS Trainings by scheduled time frame.
Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:
High School Diploma
Minimum 5 years experience in a loan compliance role or loan documentation processing role in a commercial or consumer banking environment.
Knowledge of HMDA and CRA regulations and reporting requirements preferred.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILL, ABILITY:
Knowledge and understanding of administration and perfection of consumer, commercial and real estate loans.
Knowledge and demonstrated understanding of compliance with HMDA, CRA and Adverse Action and Flood regulations and/or policies.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as job aids, policies and procedures and demonstrate ability to apply what is applicable.
Proficient knowledge of LaserPro document generation software.
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office, Word and Excel.

Ability to apply logical or critical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw conclusions. Able to analyze and interpret a variety of technical instructions and can deal with multiple variables.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrate a high level of organization, ability to prioritize and multi-task with attention to detail and accuracy, manage multiple projects, and demonstrate self-motivation and ability to follow through with tasks.
Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and handle multiple tasks simultaneous in a fast-paced, diverse, and growth-oriented environment.

Title: TMO III
Job Description:
Job Profile

Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As a TMO III within PNC's Treasury Management Sales organization, you will be based in Kansas City.

Job Description

Sets relationship strategies and directs relationship management activities with new and/or existing clients in a book of business to grow sales, revenue and market share with relevant sales goals. Typically works with clients with advanced levels of risk and complexity of needs. Works independently and may mentor other team members.
Creates and drives strategy to acquire and/or expand and retain client relationships to generate revenue and deepen share of wallet. Handles the origination, financial analysis, negotiation and documentation of credit and non-credit products and services.
Manages risk/return and drives quality for new and/or existing clients. Actively identifies and mitigates different types of risk, such as regulatory, reputational, operational and credit risks.
Focuses on client opportunities by providing ideas and insights based on an understanding of the client's needs and their financial well-being. Drives client engagement and loyalty. Generates ideas and best practices within Relationship Management and may mentor others.
Manages effective network of senior internal and external relationships, such as community or industry relationships, to actively acquire new clients and/or expand existing clients and enhance the client experience. Focuses on bringing entire bank to the client by presenting the full range of PNC's products and services. Leverages reporting and sales tools to proactively identify and successfully convert sales opportunities.
As defined with the business, demonstrates ability to analyze, evaluate and mitigate credit risk for the most complex credit requests by utilizing knowledge of advanced credit fundamentals and internal credit policies.

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Competencies

Business Acumen – Knowledge, insight, and understanding of business concepts, tools, and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.

Client Relationship Management – Knowledge and ability to determine and satisfy client needs and maintain a partnering relationship during engagements; includes influencing, communicating, presenting, facilitating, managing and developing others.

Customer Experience Management. – Implements the strategies and techniques used to ensure that customers have a positive experience with the organization and its products and services at every touch point.

Decision Making and Critical Thinking – Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions.

Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.

Prospecting. – Knowledge of prospecting principles, processes and skills; ability to identify and engage potential customers in the market. Build relationships and create opportunities. Plan, strategize and target the right industries. Create value propositions with impact.

Sales Negotiating – Applies successful financial sale solutions to negotiation concepts and techniques; ability to negotiate successfully across the organization and with customers in a constructive and collaborative manner. Negotiate structures and closes customer sales.

Selling. – Applies knowledge of banking products and services to meet customer needs and enable them to achieve their financial goals. Identifies prospecting approaches to identify potential customers and create opportunities to sell financial solutions and ideas to customers.

Tech Savvy – Advise, educate and engage clients on a variety of technological tools and resources allowing them to explore solutions to achieve their goals and financial well being.

Work Experience

Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree. Higher level education such as a Masters degree, PhD, or certifications is desirable. Industry relevant experience is typically 8+ years. Specific certifications are often required. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.
